effect: that applies to legitimacy change as a factor
usage: Used mostly for governments in exile.

effect: Reduces/increases damage to the garrisons of the current scope.

name: legitimacy_daily
effect: Increase country legitimacy per day.
usage: Used mostly for governments in exile.

effect: Same as legitimacy_daily but with a scope for TAG.
usage: Used mostly for governments in exile.

name: training_time_air_factor
effect: Reduces/increases air training time
usage: Used for efficiency or similar effects in the airforce.

name: master_ideology_drift
effect: Change in the puppets ideology per day. Will drift in the masters current ruling ideology.
usage: Does not require TfV.

name: weekly_manpower
effect: Adds x to your manpower pool per week.
modifier_type: Flat amount of manpower per week.

name: refit_speed
effect: Percentage change to refit speed.

name: navy_refit_speed
effect: Percentage change to a refit of navy groups.

name: refit_ic_cost
effect: Percentage change to the cost of refitting.

name: navy_refit_ic_cost
effect: Percentage change to a refit of navy groups.

name: naval_equipment_upgrade_xp_cost
effect: Percentage change to the the xp cost when creating a variant.

name: land_equipment_upgrade_xp_cost
effect: Percentage change to the the xp cost when creating a variant.

name: air_equipment_upgrade_xp_cost
effect: Percentage change to the the xp cost when creating a variant.

name: repair_speed_factor
effect: Percentage change ship repair speed.

name: fuel_gain_factor
effect: Percentage increase in fuel from oil

name: fuel_gain_factor_from_states
effect: Percentage increase in fuel from refineries

name: max_fuel_factor
effect: Percentage modification to fuel capacity

name: stability_factor
effect: Bonus to total stability
usage: Used mainly in national spirits to increase or lower Stability.

name: stability_weekly
effect: Gain in Stability per week
usage: Used in national spirits to reflect growth or reductions over time in Stability.

name: war_support_factor
effect: Bonus to total war support
usage: Used mainly in national spirits to reflect increased or lowered War Support.

name: war_support_weekly
effect: Gain in War support per week
usage: Used in national spirits to reflect growth or reductions over time in War Support.

name: cic_to_target_factor
effect: Used for Autonomy.(Can be used in other ways) Determines how many?% of CIV's go to designated target.
usage: Is mainly used in autonomy and puppet defines.

name: mic_to_target_factor
effect: Used for Autonomy.(Can be used in other ways) Determines how many?% of MIL's go to designated target.
usage: Is mainly used in autonomy and puppet defines.

name: extra_trade_to_target_factor
effect: Used for Autonomy.(Can be used in other ways) Modifies how much extra resources the overlord gains for free.
usage: Is mainly used in autonomy and puppet defines.

name: trade_cost_for_target_factor
effect: Used for Autonomy.(Can be used in other ways) Makes trade cheaper/more expensive
usage: Is mainly used in autonomy and puppet defines.

name: max_command_power
effect: Increases command power cap.
modifier_type: Flat added on top of the default 100
usage: Most often used in National Spirits related to military administrative ability or similar effects.

name: command_power_gain
effect: Flat bonus to the daily command power gain.
usage: Most often used in National Spirits related to military administrative ability or similar effects.

name: command_power_gain_mult
effect: Percentage bonus to the daily command power gain.
usage: Most often used in National Spirits related to military administrative ability or similar effects.

name: targeted_modifier
effect: Modifier targeted for one country.
usage: Can be used in both national spirits and in decisions. Used extensively in Vanilla for the Germany/USSR war and the China/Japan war.

name: attack_bonus_against
effect: Percentage Attack Bonus against one country
usage: Can be used in both national spirits and in decisions. Used extensively in Vanilla for the Germany/USSR war and the China/Japan war.

name: defense_bonus_against
effect: Percentage Defense Bonus against one country
usage: Can be used in both national spirits and in decisions. Used extensively in Vanilla for the Germany/USSR war and the China/Japan war.

name: special_forces_cap
effect: Increases ratio of Special Forces to Regulars
usage: The base amount of Special Forces is 2% of your total battalions deployed. This is added on top of that if used.

name: special_forces_min
effect: Increases base number of Special Force brigades allowed
modifier_type: Flat base number of battalions as special forces

name: civilian_factory_use
effect: Reduces number of available civilian factories, used mostly for decisions. Only works with Waking the Tiger enabled.

name: mobilization_speed
effect: Percentage increase to mobilization speed

name: defensive_war_stability_factor
effect: Percentage decrease to impact of defensive war on stability

name: offensive_war_stability_factor
effect: Percentage decrease to impact of offensive war on stability

name: surrender_limit
effect: Percentage increase of the amount of VPs needed to take for own country to capitulate

name: IDEOLOGY_drift
effect: Modifies the drift towards the specified ideology

name: drift_defence_factor
effect: Modifies the ideology drift defence

effect: Bonus to the daily political power gain

effect: Modifies the political power gained daily

name: conscription_factor
effect: Conscription?% bonus (applied AFTER recruitable population is calculated)

name: conscription
effect: Conscription bonus (increases recruitable population by specified?%).

name: non_core_manpower
effect: A addition to the percentage of manpower in non-cores. Base in non-cores is 2%, 0.02. (therefore, a value of 0.02 will result in 4% non-core manpower)

effect: Bonus to division attack on core territory

name: army_core_defence_factor
effect: Bonus to division defence on core territory

name: planning_speed
effect: Bonus to planning speed of armies in?%

name: research_speed_factor
effect: Overall research speed bonus. Ex. 0.1 means 10% reduced research time with -0.1 being 10% increased research time. Thus the more positive a number is, the better.

name: Research time reductions
effect: When researching specific technologies or technology categories, add_tech_bonus is used along with the category you want to have a?% reduced research time in.
example: add_tech_bonus = { 	name = GER_industrial_research 	bonus = 1 	uses = 1 	category = industry }

name: MONTHLY_POPULATION
effect: Changes monthly population growth by the specified percentage

name: nuclear_production_factor
effect: Changes nuke production by the specified percentage
